job description:
We are seeking an exceptionally talented individual with a passion for

innovation to join our Enviroment and Phenome Modeling team within the Plant

Breeding Organization. The position will be based in St. Louis at our corporate

headquarters.

As part of our diverse, highly dynamic group,

the successful candidate will be exposed to exciting research challenges and

will have ample opportunity to work with interdisciplinary scientists to

foster your career growth and development while delivering innovative

solutions.
  • *Responsibilities:**
+ Collaborateclosely with data scientists, breeders, and data engineers to providedata-driven solutions to business problems.

+ Understandthe core scientific questions and develop methodology for the integrativeusage of genomic, phenomic and environment data.

+ Developnovel methods for integrated analysis of genotype by environment.

+ Buildeffective relationships and partnerships with internal customers andstakeholders.
  • *Minimum Qualifications:**
+ APhD with a track record of productivity in the areas of statisticalgenetics, statistics, bioinformatics, computational biology, appliedmathematics, or a relevant scientific field.

+ Demonstratedexperience using machine learning/AI, or statistical methodology to solveresearch problems.

+ Exposureto computational biology, bioinformatics, or genomics.

+ Astrong scientific track record, as evidenced by published or acceptedpapers.

+ Abilityto rapidly learn new problem domains, and good decision-making andjudgement skills.

+ Abilityto work in a large team as well as independently.
  • *Preferred Qualifications:**
+ Mathematicalor statistical modeling in biological data.

+ Knowledgeof crop production system

+ Provenability to communicate complex analytical problems in clear, precise andactionable manner.

Bayer successfully completed the acquisition of

Monsanto in June 2018, bringing together Monsanto?s leadership in seeds and

plant traits with Bayer?s leadership in chemical and biological crop

protection. By joining forces, we will create even more extensive career

opportunities for talent around the world. We?re a global team working to shape

agriculture through breakthrough innovation that will benefit farmers,

consumers, and our planet.

While

we are now Bayer, we will continue to hire using separate career sites until we

can integrate our career platforms. We invite you to explore the career

opportunities available at the combined company by visiting advancingtogether.com/careers .
